intro: Berkheya aculeata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. The plant is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun conditions. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, spiny fruits. Berkheya aculeata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
